title: These Interesting Facts Prove That The World Is Not A Completely Terrible Place
text:
These Interesting Facts Prove That The World Is Not A Completely Terrible Place

These Interesting Facts Prove That The World Is Not A Completely Terrible Place

News that we read and watch is mostly all kinds of bad. From people getting lynched to horrendous rape cases popping up on a daily basis. Obviously, we have grown to accept the fact that this world is a horrible place and refuse to believe otherwise.

So we thought of making your day better with facts that are so adorable and cute that'll make you forget all the horrible things.

Read these and feel better.

1. Sheep can recognise facial expressions and they love everyone smiling.

Unsplash

2. Sunflowers face the sun. They face each other when can't find the sun.

Unsplash

3. A group of islands named Tokelau in the Pacific Ocean, receives 100 percent of its electricity from solar energy.

Unsplash

4. Some macaques, a species of monkey, in Japan have learnt how to use coins at vending machines they find in the country.

macaques

5. An Island with low population of puffins put fake puffins on sticks. This made real puffins stand on one leg trying to fit in with the fake puffins.

Unsplash

6. Vending machines in Istanbul, Turkey dispense food and water for stray dogs. The price is an empty recyclable bottle.

Unsplash

7. The voice actors for Mickey Mouse and the voice actor for Minnie Mouse eventually got married.

Unsplash

8. Did you know that Raccoons actually wash their food before eating it?

Raccoons

9. Just like human babies suck their thumb, baby elephants suck their trunks.

Unsplash

10. You can't own just one guinea pig in Switzerland. It is Illegal. A guinea pigs needs to have another.

Unsplash

11. The ozone layer if fixing itself naturally and will only take a few years to fully recover!

Unsplash

12. If a dog is putting his or her paw on you it means they are trying to pet you.

Unsplash

13. Positive thoughts help boost your energy and form better relationships.

Unsplash
description: News that we read or watch are mostly all kinds of bad ones. From people getting lynched over tiny things to horrendous rape cases popping up on a daily basis, that fact that this world is a horrible place stays with us and refuses to leave considering we've examples around.
